column4: hello, my dvd drive wont open when i push the open button located at the top of m desktop, or when i push the eject button on my keyboard, help please, thankyou
is it still mounted by any chance...?
i dont know
open a terminal and type 'sudo df -h' and see if it mentions the cdrom...
no it does not
does your drive have a pinhole in the front?
no it does not
are you sure? Nearly all of them do, as an emergency release mechanism....
i checked right now it doesnt
i know because my laptop had one but not this desktop
don't know what to tell you. Every single one of mine has it. Check in #hardware ?
how do i do that
just /join #hardware and ask in that channel....
it says canot join its invite only
sigh. Well in your place, I would shutdown the machine, making sure it powers off, and hope that when you power it back up, it resets the drive and the eject button starts working...
lol thats what i did and it didnt work, thats why its weird
i guess il use windows to burn my isos
what brand/model is the drive, so I can avoid it in the future?
i typed sudo eject and it worked
good, still doesn't excuse having no pinhole. Cheap-ass hardware....
yeah i guess i got it for  dollars with 8gb ram quadcore processor and 1gb ati video card tv tunner and wireless antena and 1tb hard drive so im not complaining
